package GlobArgv; use strict;
@ARGV = map { glob } @ARGV; 1;
__END__
=head1 NAME
GlobArgv - Enables Win32 One-Liners to Use Filename Wildcards
=head1 SYNOPSIS
perl -MGlobArgv -ne "print if /pattern/" *.csv perl -MGlobArgv -i.bak -pe "s/old/new/i" *.txt single.log
=head1 DESCRIPTION
Quick and dirty package to expand filenames containing wildcards passed as command line arguments. Win32 shells (CMD, 4NT) do not resolve wildcards by default.
A module is used to force the expansion of command line arguments before the implicit "while (<>)" loop.
=head1 BUGS AND LIMITATIONS
Very simple minded -- assumes everything on the command line is a filename that wants to be expanded.
=head1 AUTHOR
Keith S. Kiyohara, <kkiyohara@hotmail.com>
=cut
